intro: Rouliniella palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Rouliniella palmeri typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
